problem: Given the polynomials $h(x) = 2x^4 + 5x^3 - 4x^2 + x - 7$ and $j(x) = -x^4 + 3x^3 + 6x^2 - 2x + 4$, compute $h(x) - j(x)$. Write your answer as a polynomial in terms of $x$ with coefficients in descending powers of $x$.
solution: We see that $h(x) - j(x) = 2x^4 + 5x^3 - 4x^2 + x - 7 - (-x^4 + 3x^3 + 6x^2 - 2x + 4).$ Simplifying, we get $\boxed{3x^4 + 2x^3 - 10x^2 + 3x - 11}$.
